description: This course provides a capstone to the concentration.  Taught as a seminar, it investigates
critical and specialized issues in media from multiple and often competing perspectives.  Topics
change regularly and address a wide range of media-related concerns.  Sample topics include
Media and the Environment, Media and Religion, Media and Child Development, and
Documentary Studies.  Prerequisite: Media Studies 160 or permission of instructor.
Offered annually in the Spring Semester.
